Rudi Dekkers purchased Huffman Aviation in 1999, a flight school that offered training for private pilot, instrument rating, commercial pilot license, multi-engine ratings, and flight instructor certifications, but not for larger jet aircraft. Atta and al-Shehhi attended Huffman Aviation to learn to fly small aircraft, meeting Dekkers in July 2000. The school filed M-1 student visa request forms for them in August 2000 to allow enrollment in a professional pilot program. Following the attacks, the FBI investigated Huffman Aviation, seizing records that showed Atta and al-Shehhi paid $10,000 for two months of flight instruction. Dekkers cooperated with the FBI, providing records and stating that he saw no red flags. After the attacks, Dekkers experienced bankruptcy, lost his business and house, divorced, and received death threats. He also faced issues with the Internal Revenue Service, lenders, and the Federal Aviation Administration. In March 2002, Huffman Aviation was cited for safety concerns, including unlocked fuel trucks with keys in the ignition. Dekkers sold Huffman Aviation in 2003. He stated in 2011 that Atta and al-Shehhi never displayed behaviors indicative of terrorists, though Atta was described as a "dead man walking" due to his demeanor. Dekkers maintained his innocence, stating he could not have done anything about the attacks and that he lived with the impact of 9/11 daily.

query: On what day, month, and year was Ila Pant (an Indian politician) born?

documents.text: ila pant｡ila pant (born 10 march 1938) is an indian politician who was a member of parliament in 12th lok sabha from nainital constituency of uttar pradesh (now part of uttarakhand). she was married to former minister k. c. pant.personal life and familyila pant was born in nainital district (uttarakhand) on 10 march 1938. she is the daughter of shobha and govind ballabh pande. she graduated from the university of allahabad with a bachelor of arts degree. on 20 june 1957, she married the politician krishna chandra pant from uttarakhand brahmin family. the couple has two sons.politics ila pant's father-in-law govind ballabh pant was one of the major architect of modern india and a senior indian national congress leader, and her husband went on to become a minister...ila pant｡ila pant (born 10 march 1938) is an indian politician who was a member of parliament in 12th lok sabha from nainital constituency of uttar pradesh (now part of uttarakhand). she was married

Shai, an American vocal R&B/soul quartet, formed on the campus of Howard University. The name Shai is a Swahili word meaning "personification of destiny." The group gained prominence in the 1990s, best known for their 1992 debut single "[If I Ever Fall in Love]," which reached number two on the Billboard Hot 100. The members, who were fraternity brothers and fellow students, initially performed for fun before seriously pursuing a record deal after winning a talent show. Their debut album of the same name achieved platinum status.

acs award in pure chemistry｡the american chemical society award in pure chemistry is awarded annually by the american chemical society (acs) "to recognize and encourage fundamental research in pure chemistry carried out in north america by young men and women." "young" means born within 35 years of the awarding of the award, which takes place at the spring meeting of the acs. to be eligible, a nominee "must have accomplished research of unusual merit for an individual on the threshold of her or his career. special consideration is given to independence of thought and originality in the research...." the award was first awarded in 1931, with linus pauling the inaugural recipient. it is sponsored by the alpha chi sigma fraternity and the alpha chi sigma educational foundation. past...acs award in pure chemistry｡the american chemical society award in pure chemistry is awarded annually by the american chemical society (acs) "to recognize and encourage fundamental research in pure
